dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Four hundred firearms seized in just a few days—what does that say about the lingering fallout from the January events?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Four hundred firearms seized in just a few days-what does that say about the lingering fallout from the January events?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of the national operational and preventive campaign Qaru, the Ministry of Internal Affairs seized 400 firearms and over 2,500 rounds of ammunition that had been stolen during the January events, according to Polisia.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that's not even counting the 2,500 rounds of ammunition they recovered. It's uh, pretty staggering when you think about it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that's not even counting the two thousand, five hundred rounds of ammunition they recovered. It's uh, pretty staggering when you think about it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of the national operational and preventive campaign Qaru, the Ministry of Internal Affairs seized 400 firearms and over 2,500 rounds of ammunition that had been stolen during the January events, according to Polisia.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and they found all this during Operation Qaru, which only ran from June 2nd to the 6th. That's a really short window for such a huge haul.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and they found all this during Operation Qaru, which only ran from June second to the sixth. That's a really short window for such a huge haul.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of the national operational and preventive campaign Qaru, the Ministry of Internal Affairs seized 400 firearms and over 2,500 rounds of ammunition that had been stolen during the January events, according to Polisia.kz. The operation was conducted from June 2 to June 6.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, and they mentioned recovering police gear too—like body armor, helmets, even shields stolen back in January. Makes you wonder how much is still out there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, and they mentioned recovering police gear too-like body armor, helmets, even shields stolen back in January. Makes you wonder how much is still out there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: weapons and police gear stolen during the January events were recovered, including two Kalashnikov rifles, four pistols, four rifled carbines, as well as service body armor, helmets, and shields;

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And get this—they inspected over 29,000 civilian gun owners. That's a massive sweep.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And get this-they inspected over twenty nine thousand civilian gun owners. That's a massive sweep.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the report, over 29,000 civilian gun owners were inspected, and 845 individuals were held administratively liable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And 845 people faced administrative charges. But also, 87 firearms were voluntarily surrendered, which I guess shows the amnesty message is getting through?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And eight hundred forty five people faced administrative charges. But also, eighty seven firearms were voluntarily surrendered, which I guess shows the amnesty message is getting through?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the report, over 29,000 civilian gun owners were inspected, and 845 individuals were held administratively liable. 87 firearms were voluntarily surrendered, the Polisia.kz statement reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Kanat Nurmagambetov from the Criminal Police Department really stressed that point—surrender voluntarily, avoid liability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Kanat Nurmagambetov from the Criminal Police Department really stressed that point-surrender voluntarily, avoid liability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Police also inspected more than 10,000 farms and pasture-based households, where over 65 firearms of various types were confiscated, said Kanat Nurmagambetov, head of the Criminal Police Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. He emphasized: The Ministry of Internal Affairs reminds citizens that voluntarily surrendering illegally held weapons exempts one from criminal and administrative liability.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though—they didn't just focus on urban areas. They checked more than 10,000 farms and rural households too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though-they didn't just focus on urban areas. They checked more than ten thousand farms and rural households too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Police also inspected more than 10,000 farms and pasture-based households, where over 65 firearms of various types were confiscated, said Kanat Nurmagambetov, head of the Criminal Police Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And confiscated over 65 guns there. Shows how widespread this issue might be.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And confiscated over sixty five guns there. Shows how widespread this issue might be.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Police also inspected more than 10,000 farms and pasture-based households, where over 65 firearms of various types were confiscated, said Kanat Nurmagambetov, head of the Criminal Police Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Do you think campaigns like this actually make a dent in long-term public safety?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Do you think campaigns like this actually make a dent in long-term public safety?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Well, pulling six explosive devices off the streets certainly doesn't hurt. But it's gotta be part of a bigger effort, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, pulling six explosive devices off the streets certainly doesn't hurt. But it's gotta be part of a bigger effort, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Four hundred firearms, over 2,500 rounds of ammunition, and six explosive devices were removed from illegal circulation; 40 weapon and ammunition caches were discovered; weapons and police gear stolen during the January events were recovered, including two Kalashnikov rifles, four pistols, four rifled carbines, as well as service body armor, helmets, and shields;

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. I mean, encouraging voluntary surrender is one thing, but inspecting tens of thousands of owners? That's proactive policing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. I mean, encouraging voluntary surrender is one thing, but inspecting tens of thousands of owners? That's proactive policing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still makes you wonder how these weapons slipped through in the first place after January.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still makes you wonder how these weapons slipped through in the first place after January.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: No kidding. Hopefully this sends a message—you can't just hide stolen rifles and gear forever.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No kidding. Hopefully this sends a message-you can't just hide stolen rifles and gear forever.
